titles.title: Child Safety Act

To protect children from the trauma of witnessing or experiencing violence, sexual abuse, neglect, abduction, rape or death during parent/child visitations or visitation exchanges, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Select Education and Civil Rights.

bill.summary: 6/30/1993--Introduced. Child Safety Act - Authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants and enter into contracts and cooperative agreements with public or nonprofit private entities to: (1) establish and operate supervised visitation centers for child abuse victims; and (2) assist such organizations in collecting data on the effect of supervised visitation on sexually abused or severely physically abused children. Authorizes appropriations.
